Requirement: Configurable delay time for sleep mode (backlight off)
Description: It must be possible for the user to configure the time for when the display enters sleep mode (turns off backlight) after inactivity.The possible values must be: 5min, 15min, 30min, Never.
The battery condition derived from a battery self-test must be retained also after a reboot or power cycle of the UPS (stored in non-volatile memory).

If no battery self-test has ever been completed (battery condition status has never been determined) the battery condition status must be reported as unknown. The same is the case if it is indicated that the UPS batteries have been replaced.If battery is disconnected the battery condition status must remain the same.
The battery condition derived from a battery self-test must be retained also after a reboot or power cycle of the UPS (stored in non-volatile memory).

If no battery self-test has ever been completed (battery condition status has never been determined) the battery condition status must be reported as unknown. The same is the case if it is indicated that the UPS batteries have been replaced.If battery is disconnected the battery condition status must remain the same.

The user must be asked to confirm that the settings are imported/restored from the USB drive via a pop-up screen in the display. This screen must also inform the user that the NMC will reboot as part of restoring the settings.

Requirement: Trip bypass backfeed breaker in case bypass voltage sense circuit is not working correctly
Description: In case it is determined that the bypass voltage sense circuit on the SBSC is not working correctly, the bypass backfeed breaker must be tripped as the SBSC cannot measure voltages correctly and detect a bypass backfeed scenario. - UC must provide a bypass voltage VQD status for each phase to the SBSC. If UC detects the bypass voltage as OK on a phase it must report bypass voltage OK on that phase to the SBSC, else it must be reported as not OK.- UC must provide an inverter operation status to the SBSC. If UPS (or any UPS in a parallel system) is in battery operation (including battery test) or in normal operation it must report inverter operation to the SBSC.- SBSC must use the VQD and inverter operation status from UC to detect if its bypass sense circuit is working correctly. If SBSC detects the bypass voltage as not OK on one or more phases while UC reports bypass voltage OK on one or more of the same phases, and system is in inverter operation for a period of 5 seconds, SBSC must trip the bypass backfeed breaker. Or in other words, if SBSC detects the bypass voltage as not OK on a given phase it must check the UC VQD status for the same phase. If for a period of 5 seconds the UC VQD status is reported as OK, SBS VQD status as not OK for the same phase and system is in inverter operation then the SBSC must trip the bypass backfeed breaker.Example:UC (UPS) is in inverter operation -> UC indicates inverter operation to SBSCUC VQD detects all bypass phases as OK -> UC indicates VQD L1 OK, L2 OK and L3 OK to SBSCSBSC VQD detects bypass phase L1 OK, L2 Not OK and L3 OKSBSC compares VQD status to UC on each phase ->UC L1 OK and SBSC L1 OK ->  SBSC L1 sense circuit is OKUC L2 OK and SBSC L2 Not OK ->  SBSC L2 sense circuit is Not OKUC L3 OK and SBSC L3 OK ->  SBSC L3 sense circuit is OKIf the above status stays the same for 5 seconds the SBSC will trip the bypass backfeed breaker.
SY Model Type: Unitary,Integrated Parallel (IP),Parallel with Centralized Static Swtich

Requirement: Event triggered black box data capture
Description: The black box data capture must be triggered by certain events:- IGBT desaturation- Peak current (low priority)

The following general data must be captured:- The gatesignals for PWM for all switches.- Time stamp. Running counter of the clock signals used for timing the signals.- Surveillance flags (refer to specification)- Current measurements (mains input, inverter, battery)- Voltage measurements (mains input, output, inverter voltage, battery voltage, DC bus voltage)- Operation modes (inverter, PFC, charger)- Ambient temperature- Status of power module relays
The sample rate must be equal to the resolution of the PWM gate drive signals.
The black box capture data and related information must be stored as files in non-volatile memory
The lenght of a data capture linked to an event must be at least 5 switch cycles.
It must be possible to download the power module black box data capture via the NPI interface.

Requirement: Power module black box data capture
Description: In power converters it can happen that a semiconductor fails (shorts), leading the module to malfunction. Sometimes a protection circuits, like desaturation detection or peak current detection, stops the switching, and prevents the error from escalating. But it can also happen that the incident results in a destructive situation, where the semiconductors get destroyed, with severe damage to the converter as consequence.In all scenarios, the analysis of what lead to the incident is quite difficult as we have no understanding on how the converter switching pattern was at the time, and how the current flow through the semiconductors was during the incident. Therefore, root cause analysis is very problematic and cumbersome and sometimes impossible. The purpose of the power module black box capture function is to capture information about the PWM signals and the currents during the incident.
It must be possible to download the different available types of data captures as part of the report function in UPS Tuner, so that these are available in the report file.

It must be possible to configure the chemistry of the Li-ion battery as LMO (lithium manganese oxide), LFP (lithium iron phosphate) or NMC (lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxide).Based on this information the correct parameters for the curve based remaining battery runtime calculation must be selected.

Requirement: Configurable parameters for high battery temperature surveillance
Description: For the high battery temperature shutdown surveillance function it must be possible to configure the three parameters (A, B and Tau) used for the battery temperature estimation, and the limit for the high battery temperature shutdown level.

Requirement: Configurable parameters for remaining runtime estimation
Description: It must be possible to configure 11 different parameters which are used in the calculation of the remaining runtime for Li-ion: - Battery runtime calculation value 1 contains the parameter for P0y value (from 113 to 1512)- Battery runtime calculation value 2 contains the parameter for P1x value (from 45 to 14400)- Battery runtime calculation value 3 contains the parameter for P1y value (from 102 to 1360)- Battery runtime calculation value 4 contains the parameter for P1 distance “?” (gamma) value (from 25 to 500)- Battery runtime calculation value 6 contains the parameter for P2x value (from 56 to 18144)- Battery runtime calculation value 7 contains the parameter for K1 value (from 0.1 to 1)- Battery runtime calculation value 8 contains the parameter for K2 value (from 0 to 50)- Battery runtime calculation value 9 contains the parameter for K3 value (from 0 to 1)- Battery runtime calculation value 10 contains the parameter for K4 value (from 0.4 to 1.2)- Battery runtime calculation value 11 contains the parameter for K5 value (from 0.0015 to 0.00001)

It has nothing to do with runtime calculation?Runtime estimation must include estimation from temperature surveillance function. Show lowest value.Must be included in the Excel sheet with runtime calculation parameters.

It has nothing to do with runtime calculation?Runtime estimation must include estimation from temperature surveillance function. Show lowest value.Must be included in the Excel sheet with runtime calculation parameters. Not available in data sheet.

It has nothing to do with runtime calculation?Runtime estimation must include estimation from temperature surveillance function. Show lowest value.Must be included in the Excel sheet with runtime calculation parameters. Not available in data sheet.

Setting for the high temperature level where UPS must shutdown (exit battery operation).The setting is only needed for Li-Ion battery and if energy storage surveillance functions are enabled.  Range: 40 - 90 CDefault value: 71 CTo bypass or off will be activated after 5 seconds over the limit.ISSUE: Related to Battery Runtime Calculation Value 13 and 14. Requirement: Only allow 3-wire operation with UC hardware version 0P4836AJ or higher
Description: It must only be allowed to configure the UPS for, and operate in 3-wire operation if the UC hardware version 0P4836AJ.This is due to an issue seen in 3-wire operation where the voltage level of the 24V PSU that supplies the UC dips so much when the neutral bonding contactor is operated that the voltage surveillance circuit on the UC will detect the 24V as failed and prepare to shut down. The result is a load drop. This has been fixed by lowering the threshold level of the surveillance circuit to 17V on the UC 0P4836AJ.

Requirement: Remind user to check bonding contactor setting in 480V system
Description: If the UPS is configured as 480V system UPS Tuner must show a reminder to the FSR to check that the values of the related settings for ""Neutral bonding contactor present"" and ""AC wiring configuration"" are configured correctly according to the customer installation.

Requirement: Configurable if neutral bonding contactor is enabled or not
Description: It must be possible for the user to configure if a neutral bonding contactor is enabled or not in the product.Only if configured as enabled the UPS must control, and expect status feedback from, the neutral bonding contactor.
Setting for whether or not a neutral bonding contactor is present in the UPS. Possible values:Enabled / Disabled Default value:Disabled
